action.action-desc: Mr. Cotton introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To deny pretrial release for certain individuals, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Bail Post-Jail Act.

section.header: Denial for pretrial release for prior incarceration
section.text: Section 3124(e) of title 18, United States Code is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: A person shall be considered to pose a danger to the safety of the community and be ineligible for release if the judicial officer finds that the personâ€”

subparagraph.text: is charged with a felony offense;
is an adult or a juvenile charged as an adult with regard to the offense; and

has a prior felony conviction for a crime of violence that resulted in the person serving not less than 30 days in a State or Federal correctional facility, not including any period of pretrial detention without conviction.
